All who have the misfortune of hearing anything she says are met with a swift and violent death.

programme.title: Despite the Falling Snow
programme.desc: In 1950s Moscow, communist Katya secretly spies for the Americans in the Cold War arms race. When she lands her biggest assignment, stealing secrets from rising government star Alexander, the last thing she expects is to fall in love with him. Reconciling her passion for him with her beliefs about communism means making the greatest sacrifice, a sacrifice that Alexander only uncovers thirty years later.

programme.title: Two Weeks
programme.desc: A quartet of siblings gather at the North Carolina home of their dying mother, where squabbling, bickering, and ultimately, emotional healing and grace, are in the offing. Sally Field and Ben Chaplin lead the cast of this ensemble comedy-drama, costarring Julianne Nicholson and Tom Cavanagh.

programme.title: The Pact
programme.desc: Nicole and Annie reluctantly return to their childhood home to pay their respects after their mother passes away. While staying overnight in the house, the sisters sense a mysterious presence in their midst - noises startling them in the night, objects moving about, a fallen picture of an unknown woman posed next to their mother. Annie begins experiencing a series of intense & disturbing dreams, and ­visions that lead to her mother's past finally revealing itself.

programme.title: The Promise
programme.desc: Brilliant medical student Michael (Oscar Isaac) meets beautiful dance instructor Ana (Charlotte Le Bon) in late 1914. Their shared Armenian heritage sparks an attraction that turns into a romantic rivalry between Michael and Ana's boyfriend (Christian Bale), an American photojournalist. As the Ottoman Empire crumbles into war-torn chaos, their conflicting passions must be put aside as they join forces to get themselves to safety.

programme.title: At the Devil's Door
programme.desc: When ambitious young real estate agent Leigh is asked to sell a house with a checkered past, she crosses paths with a disturbed girl whom she learns is the runaway daughter of the couple selling the property. Leigh tries to intervene and help her, but becomes entangled with a supernatural force that pulls Leigh's sister Vera into its web, and has sinister plans for both of them. Starring Naya Rivera, Ashley Rickards and Catalina Sandino Moreno.

programme.title: Mistrust
programme.desc: Happy, beautiful and independent, Veronica enjoys being a mistress. No commitment, no strings and she never has to be vulnerable. She has carefully laid every brick in the walls of the fortress surrounding her heart. She's safe and having a great time. However, there is one person who knew her heart before those walls were erected, her best friend Brandon, who has stood by her for too many years to count. And while Veronica has tried to keep her feelings at bay, he is the one who holds the key that opens her Pandora's box of emotions.

programme.title: The Truth About Lies
programme.desc: Gilby Smalls (Fran Kranz) is having a meltdown. He's just been fired from his job and his girlfriend gave him the boot. Forced to move in with May (Coleen Camp), his booze-swilling man-obsessed mother, he's desperate to turn things around. Gilby's luck seems to change when he meets Rachel (Odette Annable), the very thing Gilby needs to get his life back on track. Desperate to impress her, Gilby starts to weave a web of lies; one bigger than the next. Now in a sticky mess, Gilby is forced to face the uncomfortable truth about himself.

Diagnosed with spinal cancer, 27 year old Adam (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) navigates the road to recovery with the sometimes-overbearing support of his crude best friend, Kyle (Seth Rogen), his smothering mother (Anjelica Huston) and an inexperienced therapist (Anna Kendrick). Inspired by a true story, 50/50 is an honest yet hysterically funny account of a young man's journey toward healing.

programme.title: The Promise
programme.desc: Brilliant medical student Michael (Oscar Isaac) meets beautiful dance instructor Ana (Charlotte Le Bon) in late 1914. Their shared Armenian heritage sparks an attraction that turns into a romantic rivalry between Michael and Ana's boyfriend (Christian Bale), an American photojournalist. As the Ottoman Empire crumbles into war-torn chaos, their conflicting passions must be put aside as they join forces to get themselves to safety.

programme.title: The Illusionist
programme.desc: Set in early 20th-century Vienna, a stage magician uses his magic to win back the great love of his life from a brutal enemy, her fiancé, who is also the powerful crowned prince of Austria. Stars Edward Norton, Paul Giamatti and Jessica Biel.

programme.title: Mona Lisa Smile
programme.desc: In 1953, a time when women's roles are rigidly defined, novice art history professor Katherine Watson begins teaching at the prestigious all-female Wellesley College, which despite its academic reputation, is an environment where success is measured by how well the students marry. Encouraging these women to strive for a more enlightened future, Watson challenges the administration and inspires her students to look beyond the image of what is, and consider the possibilities of what could be.

programme.title: Bang Bang Baby
programme.desc: In this dreamy sci-fi musical set in the 1960s, an isolated small town teenager believes her hopes of becoming a famous singer will come true when her rock star idol gets stranded in town and romance blooms between them but a leak in a nearby chemical plant threatens to turn her dream into a nightmare.

programme.title: The Dog Lover
programme.desc: Sara Gold is a young girl on a quest to save man's best friend. When she goes undercover to take down a dog breeder suspected of wrongdoing, she quickly finds out she might be on the wrong side of right. Sara must make a decision: to continue and follow the orders of her organization, United Animal Protection Agency, or trust her instincts and the boy she's fallen in love with.

programme.title: Rabid
programme.desc: After a young woman has a motorcycle accident that leads to experimental surgery to save her life, she develops a taste for blood that spurs a city-wide zombie epidemic.

programme.title: You, Me and Him
programme.desc: Two female lovers, one a career driven lawyer (Lucy Punch), the other a fun-loving, pot-smoking layabout (Faye Marsay), have an annoying Casanova neighbor (David Tennant). While neither woman ever wanted children, both end up pregnant, creating conflicts that cause each to re-examine their outlook on life and their relationship.

programme.title: Burke & Hare
programme.desc: A pair of financially strapped, 19th century Irishmen (Simon Pegg and Andy Serkis) discover a lucrative if gruesome source of income when they begin providing corpses for medical experiments to a well-regarded Edinburgh doctor. Their newly filled coffers and the expensive attentions of their romantic interests, however, soon pressure them to continue and even enhance the cadaver procurement process. Isla Fisher costars in this dark period comedy.

programme.title: Stolen
programme.desc: Haunted by the kidnapping and murder of his ten-year-old son, a grieving detective (Jon Hamm) seeks redemption when he investigates a fifty-year-old murder case with eerie similarities to his story. Josh Lucas and James Van Der Beek costar in this mystery thriller.

programme.title: Crowning Jules
programme.desc: Jules is a bright and sassy 17 year-old who desperately wants to leave her Midwestern family's alumni traditions behind, but to get to her once-in-a-lifetime Harvard admissions interview, she's forced to hitch a ride with her twin sister/nemesis, Madison, who is headed to a beauty pageant. Their road trip takes a turn when the teenage sisters unwittingly come into possession of a stolen jewel and are pursued by dangerous thieves.

programme.title: It Stains The Sands Red
programme.desc: In the throes of a zombie apocalypse, Molly - a troubled woman from Las Vegas with a dark past - finds herself stranded in the desert with a ravenous zombie on her tail. At first, she's easily able to outpace her undead pursuer, but things quickly become worse when she realizes the zombie doesn't need to ever stop and rest. Running low on supplies and beat down by the harsh environment, Molly must summon strength she never knew she had in order to face it.

programme.title: ATM
programme.desc: After leaving a party together, coworkers David (Brian Geraghty), Emily (Alice Eve) and Corey (Josh Peck) stop at an ATM. Pulling into a desolate parking lot, Corey gets out to get cash and a routine transaction turns into a struggle for survival when an unknown man appears outside blocking their exit. With the wintry temperatures dipping below freezing, and the morning sunrise still hours away, they have no choice but to play the man's deadly game of cat-and-mouse.

programme.title: Before I Fall
programme.desc: Sam (Zoey Deutch) seems to have everything a teenage girl could want: popularity, a hot boyfriend, cool status, fun friends, loving family and seeming happiness. But beyond the superficial, Sam's life isn't so charmed. She is one of a clique of high school mean girls who make life hell for those who are different. When Sam is killed in a car accident, she is forced to relive her last day on Earth seven times in order to get things right. She attempts to make sense of what befell her and gain a better understanding of herself and others.

programme.title: Mercy (2010)
programme.desc: A writer (Scott Caan) of highly sentimental love stories is secretly a womanizing cynic who has never actually experienced love, until he meets the beautiful and shockingly straightforward critic Mercy (Wendy Glenn), who is not fooled by his phony mawkishness. Erika Christensen costars in this romantic drama.

programme.title: Band Aid
programme.desc: Anna (Zoe Lister-Jones) and Ben (Adam Pally) are a couple who can't stop fighting. Advised by their therapist to try and work through their grief unconventionally, they are reminded of their shared love of music. In a last-ditch effort to save their marriage, they decide to turn all their fights into song, and with the help of their neighbor Dave (Fred Armisen), they start a band.(n)

programme.title: Comet
programme.desc: Justin Long and Emmy Rossum are star-crossed lovers in an alternate universe, whose relationship blooms and unravels over the course of six years. A chance encounter brings them together, and the story zigzags back and forth in time—from a meteor shower in LA, to an encounter in a Paris hotel room, to a fateful phone call— resulting in a portrait of the relationship between the cynical Dell (Long) and the quick-witted Kimberly (Rossum).(n)

programme.title: Body of Deceit
programme.desc: Alice (Kristanna Loken) is a ghostwriter for a famous author. She is halfway through the work of his new book, but cannot write anymore. A year has passed since she had a terrible accident in Malta where she was staying with her husband Max (Antonio Cupo) in his family villa and was in a coma for two weeks. Since then, she has been suffering from depression and has recurrent and cryptic nightmares. Max persuades her to go back to Malta in the hopes that something will unblock her mind so she can start working again and meet her deadline.(n)

programme.title: Boogie Woogie
programme.desc: The over-hyped, pretentious modern art scene in London is satirized in this dark ensemble comedy about the double dealings and calculated relationships encircling the effort to get an aging collector to part with a valuable painting. Gillian Anderson, Alan Cumming and Heather Graham star.(n)

programme.title: Madonna: Rebel Heart Tour
programme.desc: Concert special featuring the iconic superstar as she performs in packed arenas around the globe. Featuring new hits and beloved classics that showcase Madonna's signature visual theatrics, exquisite costumes and awe-inspiring choreography. With exclusive behind-the-scenes access that reveal the pop icon and her legion of dancers as they pour blood, sweat and tears into creating an astonishing arena show celebrated by fans around the world.(n)

programme.title: A Woman, A Part
programme.desc: Maggie Siff stars as Anna Baskin, an exhausted workaholic actress at a crossroads. She abruptly extricates herself from a successful but mind-numbing TV role, returning to a life she left behind with ex-creative partners Kate (Cara Seymour) and Isaac (John Ortiz). Director Elisabeth Subrin examines the media's portrayal of women, the nature of friendship and the difficulties of reckoning with change.(n)

programme.title: Whale Rider
programme.desc: In a small coastal village, the Maori descend from Paikea, the Whale Rider. In every generation, a male heir has succeeded to the chiefly title. When twins are born, and the boy twin dies, the chief is unable to accept his grand-daughter, Pai, as a future leader. Koro, the chief, is convinced that the tribe's misfortunes began at Pai's birth and calls for people to bring their sons to him, sure a new leader will emerge. Pai loves Koro more than anyone in the world, but she must fight him and a thousand years of tradition to fulfill her destiny.(n)

programme.title: Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work
programme.desc: This insightful, hysterically funny documentary follows comedienne Joan Rivers through a year of her life while looking back on her groundbreaking, barrier-breaking career as one of the first women to make a name for herself in the tough, male-dominated world of show business.(n)

programme.title: The Triumph of Love
programme.desc: Mira Sorvino is a princess who dons men's clothing to infiltrate a secluded estate and woo a handsome royal heir, inadvertently inflaming the passions of a philosophy tutor and a dour scientist. Ben Kingsley and Fiona Shaw costar in this witty romantic comedy.(n)

programme.title: Against the Current
programme.desc: Justin Kirk and Joseph Fiennes star in this independent drama about a middle-aged man who decides to fulfill a childhood dream of swimming 150 miles of the Hudson River with his best friend rowing alongside for encouragement, but a bittersweet hidden agenda for the feat is gradually revealed. Mary Tyler Moore costars.(n)

programme.title: Ping Pong Summer
programme.desc: In this coming of age comedy, a family vacation during the summer of 1985 changes everything for a shy teenage boy obsessed with ping pong.(n)

programme.title: Motherhood
programme.desc: A Manhattan mother of two finds herself in the midst of an epic, soul-crushing struggle when she sets out on a seemingly simple mission: arrange her two-year-old child's birthday party. Uma Thurman, Minnie Driver and Anthony Edwards star in this comedy about a "day from Hell.".(n)

programme.title: Whale Rider
programme.desc: In a small coastal village, the Maori descend from Paikea, the Whale Rider. In every generation, a male heir has succeeded to the chiefly title. When twins are born, and the boy twin dies, the chief is unable to accept his grand-daughter, Pai, as a future leader. Koro, the chief, is convinced that the tribe's misfortunes began at Pai's birth and calls for people to bring their sons to him, sure a new leader will emerge. Pai loves Koro more than anyone in the world, but she must fight him and a thousand years of tradition to fulfill her destiny.(n)

programme.title: Lucky Break
programme.desc: Peter Cattaneo ("The Full Monty") directs this British comedy starring James Nesbitt as Jimmy Hands, a raffish robber assigned to a grim correctional facility. When the prison's governor (Christopher Plummer) is persuaded to stage a production of a misguided musical based on the story of Admiral Nelson and Lady Emma Hamilton, Jimmy and his buddies seize the opportunity to plan a jailbreak. However, complicating matters is a lovely therapist (Olivia Williams), who, cast as Jimmy's costar, steals his heart. Timothy Spall and Lennie James costar.(n)

programme.title: Captains Courageous
programme.desc: Spencer Tracy won Best Actor as an earthy Portuguese fisherman who takes under wing a tycoon's spoiled young son who's fallen off a transatlantic luxury liner and been by a passing fishing boat. It's a coming-of-age adventure during which the lad learns lessons in respect, self-sufficiency and discipline. The Best Picture nominee is based on the Rudyard Kipling book. (cc).

programme.title: Random Harvest
programme.desc: After losing his memory, a World War I vet starts a new life with a showgirl. But their happiness is threatened when an accident restores his former memories -- and his former life. (cc).

programme.title: Performance
programme.desc: Kinky story of a rock star (Mick Jagger) and a mobster (James Fox). Pherber: Anita Pallenberg. Lucy: Michele Breton. Dana: Ann Sidney. (cc).

programme.title: Thieves like Us
programme.desc: Director Robert Altman's acclaimed portrait of youthful romance and bank robbery in 1930s Mississippi. Keith Carradine. Keechie: Shelley Duvall. Chicamaw: John Schuck. T-Dub: Bert Remsen. Mattie: Louise Fletcher. Lula: Ann Latham. Dee: Tom Skerritt. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: They Live by Night
programme.desc: Two young criminal lovebirds try to escape from their past and the law, but find it tough to evade both. (cc).

programme.title: A Kiss in the Dark
programme.desc: A neurotic concert pianist owns an apartment building populated by a number of wacky renters including a model. He has plans to kick them all out, but eventually is charmed by their personalities. (cc).

programme.title: Bachelor Apartment
programme.desc: A playboy with too many conquests meets a woman who is special. (cc).

programme.title: One for the Book
programme.desc: The wartime romance of a young actress (Eleanor Parker) and a GI (Ronald Reagan). Eve Arden, Wayne Morris, Kent Smith. Adapted from John van Druten's play "The Voice of the Turtle." Sophisticated fun. (cc).

programme.title: Living on Love
programme.desc: A man and woman share an apartment without meeting; one uses it at night, the other during the day because of their jobs. As they grate on each other's nerves, they play ambitious practical jokes on one another. Based on a novel by John K. Wells. (cc).

programme.title: George Washington Slept Here
programme.desc: Adaptation of the George S. Kaufman-Moss Hart Broadway hit about a city couple who buy a ramshackle Colonial-era farmhouse in upstate New York and their frustrating and costly attempts to renovate it. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Window
programme.desc: A young boy who is prone to lying claims to have witnessed a killing take place in a neighboring New York City apartment, but can't get anyone to believe him---except the murderers. The film is from a story by Cornell Woolrich, who wrote a similarly themed tale that was adapted for Hitchcock's "Rear Window." (cc).

programme.title: Wait Until Dark
programme.desc: A blind woman inadvertently comes into possession of a doll stuffed with heroin and is targeted by three criminals who want to get their hands on the drugs. However, she proves to be more resourceful than the deadly trio expect. (cc).

programme.title: The Apartment
programme.desc: An office worker loans his tiny New York City flat to his superiors for their secret romantic trysts and is subsequently promoted for maintaining silence about the affairs, but he runs into trouble when he gets involved with his callous boss' girlfriend. An Oscar winner for Best Picture and Director (Billy Wilder). (cc).

programme.title: Cooley High
programme.desc: Variation on "American Graffiti," focusing on black teens in a 1960s Chicago neighborhood as they prepare to leave high school and enter the real world. A vintage Motown soundtrack is included. The screenplay was written by Eric Monte, who also charted similar grounds in the TV sitcom "What's Happening!

programme.title: Sounder
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee concerns dirt-poor black sharecroppers during the Depression who face adversity when the father is jailed for stealing to feed his family, leaving his wife to struggle to care for their three children and tend to the farm. Paul Winfield and Cicely Tyson were Oscar-nominated as the parents, and the film received a nod for Best Adapted Screenplay. (cc).

programme.title: Bright Road
programme.desc: A dedicated schoolteacher and an understanding principal in help a rebellious student overcome his circumstances and his pride in order to fulfill his potential. (cc).

programme.title: The Learning Tree
programme.desc: Gordon Parks' adaptation of his own novel about a black teenager living in 1920s Kansas. After witnessing a murder, he must decide if he should come forward to clear the man being framed for the crime. (cc).

programme.title: Fame
programme.desc: Students at a performing arts school deal with various personal problems while seeking fame and fortune. (cc).

programme.title: Make Me a Star
programme.desc: A grocery clerk travels to Hollywood to become a star. Based on the novel "Merton of the Movies" by Harry Leon Wilson, and the play by George S. Kaufman, Marc Connelly and Moss Hart.

programme.title: Live, Love and Learn
programme.desc: An artist acquires the craving for material wealth that his ex-socialite wife had relinquished, making it a tough adjustment for both of them as they settle into married life. (cc).

programme.title: Murder on a Honeymoon
programme.desc: Edna May Oliver's third (and final) spin as schoolteacher-turned-sleuth Hildegarde Withers, this time getting mixed up in three murders on Catalina Island. The role would later be undertaken by Helen Broderick and ZaSu Pitts. (cc).

programme.title: Idiot's Delight
programme.desc: Robert E. Sherwood's play about a hoofer (Clark Gable) who meets an old flame (Norma Shearer) posing as a countess in prewar Europe. Edward Arnold, Charles Coburn, Burgess Meredith, Joseph Schildkraut, Laura Hope Crews, Virginia Grey. Directed by Clarence Brown. (cc).

programme.title: That Inferior Feeling
programme.desc: Sad-sack everyman Joe Doakes (Robert Benchley) has a rough time dealing with everyday situations and people in authority.

programme.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: An adaptation of the Broadway hit about an imperious, acid-tongued lecturer who, after being injured in a fall in front of an Ohio family's abode, becomes their surprise houseguest while he recovers, and proceeds to drive them crazy. (cc).

programme.title: Weekend for Three
programme.desc: The one about the neglected wife (Jane Wyatt) who tries to make her husband (Dennis O'Keefe) jealous with her attentions to a former beau (Philip Reed). Edward Everett Horton, ZaSu Pitts, Franklin Pangborn, Marion Martin, Hans Conried, Mady Lawrence. Good fun. Irving Reis directed. (cc).

programme.title: Stage Door
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee is a portrait of aspiring actresses in a theatrical rooming house, among them are a debutante newcomer, her caustic roommate and a sweet actress who's literally starving. An adaptation of the Edna Ferber-George S. Kaufman play. (cc).

programme.title: A Night at the Opera
programme.desc: The Marx Brothers spoof the opera world as a penny-ante promoter promises to arrange entrance into high society for a wealthy dowager if she antes up $200,000 as a patron of the arts. Plenty of gags and music. Watch for the famed "stateroom scene," where untold amounts of people squeeze into tiny quarters on a ship. (cc).

programme.title: A Night at the Movies
programme.desc: A series exploring various cinema genres, including thrillers, epics, Westerns, musicals and more.

programme.title: The Young Lions
programme.desc: Three different men experience combat in WWII. One is a German who becomes disillusioned with Nazism, one is an American entertainer who ends up being drafted, and the third is a sensitive Jewish-American who discovers anti-Semitism from his own comrades. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Some Came Running
programme.desc: An embittered World War II veteran, whose writing career has stalled, returns to his serene hometown with an easy woman in tow. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Rio Bravo
programme.desc: In 1860s Texas, a small-town county sheriff, his cantankerous old deputy, an alcoholic lawman and a young gunslinger try to keep a murderous thug jailed long enough for the U.S. marshal to arrive on the scene. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Toys in the Attic
programme.desc: Adaptation of Lillian Hellman's play about a shiftless Southerner who returns with his bride to the family home in New Orleans, where he is welcomed by his two unmarried older sisters who hope that he will be able to offer much-needed financial help. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Ada
programme.desc: A girl from the wrong side of the tracks weds a governor and helps him stand up to the corrupt state officials who seek to control him and his leadership. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Boom Town
programme.desc: Two friendly oil wildcatters make a fortune, but compete for the love of the same woman. When the one who wins her starts to cheat on her, the other tries to pay the mistress to go away so that the woman he still loves won't be heartbroken. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Without Reservations
programme.desc: A female author travels to Hollywood to oversee an adaptation of one of her novels. She pushes for a man she meets on the journey to play the lead role, but the actor is actually a military vet who has problems with the factual errors in her book. Soon the two feud, but eventually fall in love. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Secret Heart
programme.desc: A widow has problems with a neurotic stepdaughter who is having severe trouble adjusting to her father's death. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Parrish
programme.desc: The struggles of a tobacco grower. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Skylark
programme.desc: The frustrated and neglected wife of an advertising exec divorces her husband and takes up with a peripatetic lawyer, but finds herself experiencing doubts about the choice. (cc).(n)

programme.title: It Happened One Night
programme.desc: Frank Capra's classic about a spoiled heiress on the lam from her father, and the gruff reporter who hooks up with her as they travel northward, engage in a series of misadventures and begin to fall for each other. The first film to sweep all five major Oscars: Best Picture, Director (Capra), Screenplay (Robert Riskin), Actor (Clark Gable) and Actress (Claudette Colbert). (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Hunger Games Mockingjay, Part 2
programme.desc: In the fourth and final installment of the "Hunger Games" saga, Katniss and her allies face their biggest challenge yet as the uprising sets its sights on revenge against President Snow during its siege of the Capitol. Meanwhile, Katniss must also deal with her brainwashed ex-lover and tensions with her current beau. (cc).

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: O Ke Ali'I Wale No Ka'u Makemake (My Desire Is Only for the Chief)
programme.desc: Season 6 ends with McGarrett and Danny working undercover as drug pilots to stop a meth epidemic on the island. When McGarrett is seriously wounded, Danny is forced to break their cover and land the plane in order to save his partner's life. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: No Ke Ali'i Wahine A Me Ka 'Aina (For Queen and Country)
programme.desc: Five-0 works with rogue MI-6 agent Harry Langford to find a terrorist planning to cause nuclear reactors across Europe to melt down. Meanwhile, McGarrett and Danny ask retired FBI profiler Alicia Brown to help them find a serial killer vigilante. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: FBI profiler Alicia Brown is forced to join McGarrett in the hunt for the chess-piece killer when she finds a body in her bed. Meanwhile, Kono reconnects with a former surfing competitor who is now a disabled and homeless war veteran. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: Hu a'e ke ahi lanakila a Kamaile (The Fire of Kamile Rises in Triumph)
programme.desc: McGarrett and Alicia are kidnapped by the serial killer who has been terrorizing the island after they discover his identity. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.desc: In this spy thriller set in 1989 Berlin, MI6 agent Lorraine Broughton must obtain a stolen list of Western spies while the city around her descends into chaos and revolution. In time, her pursuit leads her to uncover a much-larger conspiracy. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: It
programme.desc: In a small town in 1989 Maine, seven bullied kids discover that a malevolent force is preying on the local children. When they realize that the town's adults can't protect them, they band together to destroy the monster, a killer clown called Pennywise. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: Segments include traveling to Mt. Everest to meet the Sherpas of Nepal; an exploration into objectification of women in sports; and an interview with former tennis player Mansour Bahrami, also known as the Court Jester. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Brothers McMullen
programme.desc: Three Irish-Catholic siblings living in the same house in Long Island, NY grapple with romantic problems. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Garden State
programme.desc: A twentysomething slacker (writer-director Zach Braff) faces his estranged family when he returns to New Jersey for his mother's funeral. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Kissing Jessica Stein
programme.desc: A straight woman who is fed up with men decides to answer a personal ad from another woman. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: In the Cut
programme.desc: Meg Ryan sheds her “good girl” screen persona to play a New York teacher involved in the search for a vicious serial killer in this sexually charged whodunit. Mark Ruffalo costars as a detective with whom Ryan begins a torrid affair. Jennifer Jason Leigh. Jane Campion directed and co-wrote the script with Susanna Moore, the author of the 1995 novel “In the Cut.” (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Dolphin Tale 2
programme.desc: A group of sympathetic humans help a dolphin with a damaged tail in this heartwarming sequel to the surprise 2011 hit. Inspired by actual events. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: State of Play
programme.desc: Adaptation of the British miniseries concerning suspicious events that set a rising congressman and a dogged reporter on a dangerous collision course. A U.S. congressman Stephen Collins is ascending the ladder of power, but his bid for the presidency hits the skids after his research assistant/mistress is viciously murdered. Now top reporter Cal McAffrey is eager to get the truth. But McAffrey has just walked into a major cover-up. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Goodbye Christopher Robin
programme.desc: This historical drama details the relationship between children's author A.A. Milne and his son Christopher Robin, which was changed forever when Milne used his child and his stuffed animals as inspirations for the Winnie the Pooh stories. As the fanciful tales bring hope to England in the wake of World War I, the family deal with fame and unwanted attention. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Gifted
programme.desc: A bachelor named Frank tries his best to raise his 7-year-old niece Mary in rural Florida. But when it's revealed that Mary is a budding math prodigy, Frank gets into a custody battle with his mother over what's best for her future. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Analyze This
programme.desc: An anxiety-ridden New York crime boss forces a beleaguered psychiatrist to treat him, summoning the doctor for his professional help at all hours and in all places, even including the doc's Florida wedding to a TV reporter. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Kill the Messenger
programme.desc: A reporter investigates a possible link between the CIA and the importing of cocaine into the U.S. in the 1980s. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: When 400,000 British and Allied troops end up trapped on the beaches of Dunkirk, France, following a catastrophic defeat during WWII, a number of civilian boats set out to rescue them before they are decimated by the approaching Nazi forces. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Theory of Everything
programme.desc: This biopic of celebrated physicist Stephen Hawking explores his early years at Cambridge, where he fell in love with liberal-arts student and future wife Jane shortly before being diagnosed with ALS. As the years progress, Jane begins to feel more like a nurse than a spouse, and Hawking develops feelings for a woman who is hired to care for him. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Beguiled
programme.desc: In this Civil War drama, a deserter from the Union Army seeks refuge at an all-female boarding school in Virginia, where the ladies compete for his affections while tending to his injuries. His presence at the school slowly poisons the relationships between the various women, who eventually turn on the soldier. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Terminator Salvation
programme.desc: Set in the year 2018, John Connor leads the human resistance against the computer network Skynet as the machines grow more aggressive than ever before. John was raised to believe in a specific version of the future, but that future begins to shift with the appearance of mysterious former death-row inmate Marcus Wright. As John and Marcus venture into the mechanical heart of Skynet's operations, they make a terrifying discovery about the potential fate of the human race. (cc).

programme.title: A Time to Kill
programme.desc: Absorbing adaptation of John Grisham's first novel, about a white lawyer defending a black man who's on trial for killing his daughter's rapists in a racially divided Mississippi town. (cc).

programme.title: The Cooler
programme.desc: A lifelong loser (William H. Macy), employed by a Las Vegas casino to stop gamblers' hot streaks, gets lucky in love. Deftly acted, well-written drama with Maria Bello and Alec Baldwin (Best Supporting Actor nominee). Directorial debut for co-screenwriter Wayne Kramer, who was nominated for a Grand Jury Prize at the Sundance Film Festival. (cc).

programme.title: W.
programme.desc: Josh Brolin gives a pitch-perfect performance as President George W. Bush in Oliver Stone's surprisingly restrained biopic tracing Bush's transformation from a privileged, partying frat boy to a born-again Christian and conservative politician. Elizabeth Banks, Ellen Burstyn, James Cromwell, Richard Dreyfuss. (cc).

programme.title: The Quiet American
programme.desc: Superbly acted adaptation of Graham Greene's novel about the complex friendship between a British journalist and an American agent in 1952 Vietnam. Michael Caine (who was nominated for an Oscar), Brendan Fraser. Directed by Phillip Noyce on location. A less faithful film version was made in 1958, starring Michael Redgrave and Audie Murphy. (cc).

programme.title: Trouble No More
programme.desc: A chronicle of Bob Dylan's "gospel" period, which spanned the album trilogy "Slow Train Coming" (1979), "Saved" (1980) and "Shot of Love (1981), features concert footage in Toronto and Buffalo in 1980; and sermons written by Luc Sante and delivered by Michael Shannon. (cc).

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: An employment-agency owner is enlisted to impersonate the President to avoid a scandal when an extramarital dalliance leads to a mishap that puts the commander in chief in a coma. (cc).

programme.title: Collateral Beauty
programme.desc: A New York adman deals with the pain of losing a child by writing letters to Time, Death and Love. He is soon visited by representations of the three concepts, and they, along with his close friends, help him return to some semblance of a normal life. (cc).

programme.title: An Affair to Remember
programme.desc: A man and woman meet and fall in love while aboard an ocean liner en route to New York. They agree to meet at the top of the Empire State building in six months to resume their romance provided they've both ended their current respective relationships. Remake of the 1939 classic “Love Affair.” (cc).

programme.title: Hannah and Her Sisters
programme.desc: Woody Allen wrote, directed and stars in this relationship comedy about three Manhattan sisters and the men in their lives. One of the women suspects her husband of lusting after her youngest sister. Oscars went to Allen for his screenplay and to supporting actors Dianne Wiest and Michael Caine. (cc).

programme.title: West Side Story
programme.desc: Rival New York street gangs war in Manhattan over turf boundaries while two youths fall in love, but they are from opposing groups. (cc).

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: A couple (John Cusack, Kate Beckinsale) decide to let fate determine if they are meant for each other. Charming but contrived essay about love and destiny. Eugene Levy steals scenes as an uptight salesman. Directed by Peter Chelsom. (cc).

programme.title: Annie Hall
programme.desc: Woody Allen cowrote and directed this Best Picture, and stars as a neurotic Jewish comedian and writer recounting the roller-coaster relationship he had with a kooky, WASPish aspiring singer. The film employs fantasy flashbacks, direct-to-camera monologues, subtitles and even a cartoon sequence to tell its tale. (cc).

programme.title: Date Night
programme.desc: Mild-mannered married couple Phil and Claire steal a dinner reservation, which leads to a case of mistaken identity. Turns out the reservation was for a pair of thieves, and now a number of unsavory characters want them dead. If they can survive a wacky and life-threatening night, they may just rediscover the passion missing from their marriage. (cc).

programme.title: Snatched
programme.desc: A free-spirited woman convinces her anxious mother to join her on a vacation to South America she'd been planning with her beau before they broke up. However, their trip turns into a wild adventure when they escape from an attempted kidnapping. (cc).

programme.title: Outcast
programme.desc: Kyle tries to get the family to safety as the town becomes overrun by the possessed, while Anderson takes Megan under wing, taking her to seek solace in an unusual spot. Later, Chief Giles realizes his wife has been resorting to desperate measures. (cc).

programme.title: Fifty Shades Darker
programme.desc: In this sequel to "Fifty Shades of Grey," the demure Anastasia Steele and possessive businessman Christian Grey pursue a more open and trusting relationship. However, their attempts are threatened by several of his past lovers. (cc).

programme.title: Romeo Must Die
programme.desc: Violent take on “Romeo and Juliet” centering on the love affair between a Chinese escaped prisoner (Jet Li) and the daughter of the head of a black crime syndicate. The action packs a punch, but the script is packed with clichés. Pop star Aaliyah (1979-2001) costars and performs four songs on the soundtrack. Isaiah Washington. Andrzej Bartkowiak directed. (cc).

programme.title: Invictus
programme.desc: President Nelson Mandela inspires the South African rugby team to strive for the World Cup in hopes of soothing the country's racial tensions. As rugby captain Francois Pienaar leads his team on a winning streak, the people of South Africa are brought together by their collective desire for a major sports victory. (cc).

programme.title: The Guru
programme.desc: An Indian dancer goes to Manhattan to become an actor and finds himself boarding with distant relatives and caught up in a love triangle. (cc).

programme.title: Four Christmases
programme.desc: When their annual vacation getaway falls through, a happily unmarried couple are forced to spend Christmas with the families of their four divorced parents on the same day. (cc).

programme.title: Rush Hour 2
programme.desc: A wisecracking L.A. cop (Chris Tucker) visits his friend the inspector (Jackie Chan) in Hong Kong, and is drawn into a case involving a mob bigwig and a counterfeiting ring. Chan's stunts punch up this predictable crime yarn. A sequel to 1998's “Rush Hour.” Brett Ratner directed. (cc).

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: A team of high-class thieves set out to avenge their mentor's death with the help of his daughter. The plan consists of them stealing a fortune in gold, having it pilfered from them and then trying to get it back. (cc).

programme.title: The Losers
programme.desc: A team of mercenaries wage war on the CIA after they're double-crossed by rogue agent Max (Jason Patric) during a mission in the Bolivian jungle. But in order to get to Max, the team will need a little help from sexy operative Aisha (Zoe Saldana), who has her own reasons for joining the fight. (cc).

programme.title: Back to the Future Part II
programme.desc: A teen time-travels from 1985 to 2015 in order to save his parents and his children from the disasters precipitated by his own mistake when he traveled to 1955 and bought a book in order to enrich himself in the future. (cc).

programme.title: Eight Below
programme.desc: Thrilling adventure yarn about eight sled dogs struggling to survive when bad weather leaves them marooned at an Antarctic research post. The fact-based film is similar to the 1983 Japanese film "Nankyoku Monogatari," which was released in the U.S. as "Antarctica." (cc).

programme.title: Fast and Furious
programme.desc: When fugitive ex-con Dom Toretto returns to Los Angeles seeking the truth behind a high-profile crime, Agent Brian O'Conner reluctantly seeks out his help in order to take down a common enemy. Speeding from the streets of L.A. into the Mexican desert in convoy heists and precision tunnel crawls, Dom and Brian attempt to get their man while exploring thrilling new frontiers in the fine art of racing. (cc).

programme.title: King Arthur Legend of the Sword
programme.desc: Arthur draws the legendary sword Excalibur from the stone, and must learn to harness its power in order to lead a rebellion against his uncle Vortigern, who murdered Arthur's father and usurped the throne years ago. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Jupiter Ascending
programme.desc: In this sci-fi epic in which human beings are the least-evolved species in the known universe, an ex-soldier protects a seemingly ordinary woman who's been targeted for assassination by a ruthless queen. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: A team of high-class thieves set out to avenge their mentor's death with the help of his daughter. The plan consists of them stealing a fortune in gold, having it pilfered from them and then trying to get it back. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Ref
programme.desc: When a cat burglar is ditched by his partner in the middle of a break-in, he takes a bickering Connecticut couple hostage. Seeking to get out of the situation alive, and out of handcuffs, the burglar acts as referee to sort out their family problems. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Dragon The Bruce Lee Story
programme.desc: Biopic of the legendary martial-arts master Bruce Lee. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Heaven Help Us
programme.desc: Several Catholic school boys get into ever increasing amounts of trouble with the presiding priests of their parochial school in 1965 Brooklyn, while also discovering the opposite sex during their formative years. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Mr. 3000
programme.desc: An arrogant baseball player leaves the game the moment he collects his 3000th hit, but, years later, when a statistical snafu is discovered and his total is lowered, the over-the-hill slugger must come out of retirement to reach the milestone and cement his place in baseball history. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Why Him?
programme.desc: An adoring dad is horrified to discover that his daughter's tech-billionaire boyfriend is a tattooed, party-hearty lout. Despite the latter's heart of gold, the father refuses to warm to him—especially when he learns about his engagement plans. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Going in Style
programme.desc: Three elderly friends and retired steelworkers are outraged to learn that their pension fund has been raided by a shady corporation. In response, they decide to rob one of the corporation's banks to get their hard-earned money back. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future
programme.desc: An eccentric scientist builds a time machine, which accidentally transports a high-school student back to the 1950s, where the teen inadvertently interferes with the budding romance between his future parents. programme.title: 50 First Dates
programme.desc: A Hawaii veterinarian falls for a woman with short-term memory loss. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Knight and Day
programme.desc: A single woman and a spy race to elude a federal agent and uncover the truth about a clandestine mission gone awry. Meanwhile, a CIA director attempts to discover why the unlikely duo have taken flight. Extended edition. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Final Destination
programme.desc: Terror comes at a frightening clip when a group of teens have a close brush with death at a racetrack, only to find the Grim Reaper striking back at them with a vengeance. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: In this adaptation of the popular video-game series, a death-row convict relives his ancestor's memories as an assassin in 15th-century Spain. From this out-of-body experience, he gains the training he needs to battle a conspiracy in the present day. (cc).

Next, Maddie heads to a factory where a party favourite is made - chocolate! We learn how chocolate starts out as a fruit, and we see the chocolates being made for an assortment box. Maddie also uses her special camera to see the super-fast robots that put the different chocolates into the right holes in their boxes.

Bitz decides to throw the best beach party ever to make up for it. There are snacks, games, a dance floor and even a basketball hoop! But it's a very warm day and soon everyone is too hot to party. Eventually David, with Grandma Zainab's help, works out that Laila's problem isn't stage fright but more to do with her difficulties with reading. programme.desc: In today's episode, Maddie is relaxing at home, playing games and watching television. She shows us how a television screen works using millions of tiny squares called pixels. Using her special microscope camera, Maddie shows us how a pixel can make any colour from just three coloured lights - red, blue and green. Next she visits a factory where carpet is made. Maddie follows the journey that wool takes, from shearing a sheep to going through the factory, to end up in the carpets we have at home. Maddie uses her special slow-motion camera to show us how the different coloured threads are woven together on a loom to make a carpet.(n)
